DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effect mobile phone intervention 'Connected Care ' attendance rate cervical cancer screen check-up appointment .
DOC.brief_title: Connected Care : Use Mobile Short Message Services Improve HPV Care
DOC.detailed_description: Connected Care two-site RCT ( Randomised Clinical Trial ) , effect mHealth intervention compare standard care group woman undergo VIA ( Visual Inspection Acetic Acid ) test HR ( High-Risk ) HPV ( Human Papilomavirus ) . Post testing , HPV-positive woman receive home visit community health worker inform result HPV-test invite check-up appointment 12 month later . In 12-month period follow , intervention group receive mHealth ( Mobile Health ) message cervical cancer prevent regular screening ; quiz base mHealth message ; sms-reminders check-up appointment . The primary hypothesis intervention increase attendance rate 15 % . The effect intervention 12-month check-up attendance rate HR HPV-positive woman ( intervention control group ) .
DOC.criteria: HPVpositive Able give inform consent Do access mobile phone/ provide phone number
